parts.text: {"word":"fragment","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"破片、断片、かけら","english_definition":"a small part broken or separated off something.","examples":[{"sentence":"The vase broke into fragments.","translation":"花瓶は砕けて破片になった。"},{"sentence":"I found fragments of glass on the floor.","translation":"床にガラスの破片を見つけた。"},{"sentence":"The archaeologist discovered fragments of ancient pottery.","translation":"考古学者は古代の陶器の断片を発見した。"}],"collocations":["glass fragment (ガラスの破片)","bone fragment (骨片)","rock fragment (岩の破片)","pottery fragment (陶器の破片)","memory fragment (記憶の断片)"],"synonyms":["piece","shard","splinter","chip","scrap","morsel"],"antonyms":["whole","entirety"]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"未完の部分、不完全な部分、断章","english_definition":"an incomplete part; a part broken off or detached.","examples":[{"sentence":"The book is a fragment of a larger work.","translation":"その本はより大きな作品の断章である。"},{"sentence":"We only have fragments of the original document.","translation":"元の文書の断片しか残っていない。"},{"sentence":"The play exists only in fragments.","translation":"その劇は断片的にしか存在しない。"}],"collocations":["literary fragment (文学的な断章)","musical fragment (音楽の断片)","historical fragment (歴史的な断片)","philosophical fragment (哲学的な断章)"],"synonyms":["excerpt","extract","segment","portion","section","part"],"antonyms":["complete work","whole piece"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(物を)粉砕する、ばらばらにする","english_definition":"to break or cause to break into fragments.","examples":[{"sentence":"The explosion fragmented the building.","translation":"爆発で建物は粉々になった。"},{"sentence":"The rock was fragmented by the impact.","translation":"岩は衝撃で粉砕された。"}],"collocations":["fragment a rock (岩を粉砕する)","fragment a building (建物を粉砕する)"],"synonyms":["shatter","splinter","crumble","disintegrate","pulverize"],"antonyms":["assemble","unify","consolidate"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"粉砕する、ばらばらになる","english_definition":"to break into fragments.","examples":[{"sentence":"The ice fragmented into small pieces.","translation":"氷は細かく砕けた。"},{"sentence":"The organization fragmented after the leader's death.","translation":"組織はリーダーの死後、分裂した。"}],"collocations":["fragment into pieces (粉々になる)","fragment into groups (グループに分裂する)"],"synonyms":["disintegrate","crumble","splinter","break up","split"],"antonyms":["coalesce","unite","merge"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(コンピューター)断片化する","english_definition":"(in computing) to divide (a file) into separate blocks for storage.","examples":[{"sentence":"The hard drive was heavily fragmented.","translation":"ハードドライブはひどく断片化されていた。"},{"sentence":"Defragmenting the hard drive can improve performance.","translation":"ハードドライブをデフラグすると、パフォーマンスが向上する。"}],"collocations":["fragment a file (ファイルを断片化する)","fragment memory (メモリを断片化する)"],"synonyms":["segment","divide","split"],"antonyms":["defragment","consolidate"]}],"etymology":{"value":"ラテン語の「frāgmentum」（破片、断片）に由来し、これは「frangere」（壊す、砕く）という動詞から派生した。「frangere」はインド・ヨーロッパ祖語の根 *bhreg- （壊す）に遡る。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ˈfræɡmənt/","syllables":"frag-ment"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"fragments","verb_forms":{"present_simple":["fragment","fragments"],"past_simple":"fragmented","past_participle":"fragmented","present_participle":"fragmenting"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**fragment**」は、物理的な物体の破片や、抽象的な概念の断片を指す言葉です。名詞としては、壊れた物のかけらや、未完成の作品の一部などを意味します。動詞としては、何かを粉々に砕いたり、組織やグループが分裂したりすることを表します。コンピューターの分野では、ファイルが分割されて保存される状態を指します。文脈によって意味が異なるため、注意が必要です。","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ I found a fragment of the vase's pieces.","correct":"✓ I found a fragment of the vase.","note":"「破片」はすでに細かくなっている状態を指すので、「pieces」を付け加える必要はありません。"},{"incorrect":"✗ The memory was fragmentated.","correct":"✓ The memory was fragmented.","note":"動詞の過去分詞形は「fragmentated」です。"},],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["fragmentary (形容詞: 断片的な、不完全な)","fragmentation (名詞: 断片化、分裂)"],"phrasal_verbs":[],"related_concepts":["shard","splinter","chip","piece","section","segment","portion","excerpt","extract","division","separation","scattering","disintegration","decomposition"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"比較的低頻度 (Relatively low frequency) - 学術的な文脈や専門分野でよく使われる。","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"「**fragment**」は、何か全体が壊れてできた小さな部分や、完全ではない一部を意味する言葉です。名詞としては、壊れたガラスの「破片」や、昔の文章の「断片」のように使われます。動詞としては、何かを壊してバラバラにしたり、グループが分裂したりすることを表します。また、コンピューターの世界では、ファイルが細かく分かれて保存されることを指します。少し難しい言葉ですが、学術的な文章や専門的な分野でよく使われます。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The explosion left only a few **fragments** of the building standing.","translation":"爆発により、建物はわずかな破片を残すのみとなった。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"破片"},{"sentence":"We only have **fragments** of information about what happened that night.","translation":"その夜に何が起こったのかについて、私たちは断片的な情報しか持っていない。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"断片"},{"sentence":"The vase **fragmented** when it hit the floor.","translation":"花瓶は床にぶつかったときに粉々になった。","type":"verb (vi)","meaning_category":"粉砕する"},{"sentence":"The political party began to **fragment** after the election.","translation":"その政党は選挙後、分裂し始めた。","type":"verb (vi)","meaning_category":"分裂する"},{"sentence":"The file was **fragmented** on the hard drive, slowing down the computer.","translation":"ファイルはハードドライブ上で断片化されており、コンピューターの動作を遅くしていた。","type":"verb (vt)","meaning_category":"断片化する"}]}
